citeinfo.origin: Alberta Environment and Sustainable Resource Development, Government of Alberta
citeinfo.title: Phase 1 (Broad Scale) Forest Inventory Index

pubinfo.publish: Alberta Environment and Sustainable Resource Development, Government of Alberta

descript.abstract:
This dataset is produced for the Government of Alberta and is available to the general public. Please consult the Distribution Information of this metadata for the appropriate contact to acquire this dataset.
During and shortly after the Second World War the demand for lumber and wood products increased dramatically. This resulted in concern over lack of knowledge about the extent of the provincial forest resource, and led to fears that the timber supply could be easily depleted. The Phase 1, or Broad Scale Forest Inventory was initiated in 1949 in response to these concerns. The inventory served as the information base to plan the management of Alberta's forest resource. The Phase 1 (Broad Scale) Forest Inventory included all publicly owned forested lands in the province except Indian lands, national parks and an area known as the Rocky Mountains Forest Reserve. Through aerial photo interpretation, land was classed according to vegetation cover as productive, potentially productive or non-productive.
The Phase 1 (Broad Scale) Forest Inventory generalized data, scanned images, reports, status map and index map are available from Alberta Environment and Sustainable Resource Development, Government of Alberta.
descript.purpose: The Phase 1 (Broad Scale) Forest Inventory index map is intended to depict the areas that have been captured as part of the program. The Phase 1 (Broad Scale) Forest Inventory was used to define lands suitable for agriculture, to determine timber harvest levels and plan forest protection and timber and industrial development.
descript.supplinf: This index map is intended to reflect the availability of data that are collected under the Phase 1 (Broad Scale) Forest Inventory program.

idinfo.accconst: General Public: For conditional general public use. User must accept terms and conditions in a product license agreement before obtaining data. Government of Alberta Ministries: Conditional access to this data for internal business purposes is available to Government of Alberta Ministries and authorized agencies through Resource Information Management Branch of Alberta Environment and Sustainable Resource Development.
idinfo.useconst: General Public: This digital data is protected under copyright to the Government of Alberta with all rights reserved and is subject to the conditions outlined in the Resource Information Management Branch License Agreement for Digital Data. Government of Alberta Ministries: Government of Alberta Ministries and authorized agencies may conditionally use this data for internal business purposes which includes conditional sharing of the data with other third parties (i.e. contractors, stakeholders) if necessary for reasonable use of the data relating to the provision of services to the Crown as represented by each Ministry.

cntinfo.cntpos: Resource Analysis Section, Forest Management Branch, Forestry Division
cntinfo.cntinst: This is the point of contact regarding the creation of, and characteristics of, the data set. Queries about the creation and/or characteristics of the data set submitted through facsimile or electronic mail must include the salutation "Attention: Resource Analysis Section, Forest Management Branch, Forestry Division; Dataset: Phase 1 (Broad Scale) Forest Inventory Index". For Distribution Information contact instructions, refer to the Distribution Information section of this metadata record. For Metadata Information contact instructions, refer to the Metadata Reference Information section of this metadata record.

citeinfo.othercit: This dataset reflects the extent and availability of the Phase 1 (Broad Scale) Forest Inventory maps.

attracc.attraccr: There is no attribution on the dataset.

dataqual.complete: The data are complete for the extent of the Phase 1 (Broad Scale) Forest Inventory area except for a small area of mapsheet 83I04, which was not digitized. Mapsheet 83G16 was included in the collection of scanned images but does not appear to contain any forest inventory data.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

distinfo.distliab: The user agrees that the information and each part thereof, any formatting or presentation thereof, any storage media on which it is provided, and any communication of any kind, incidental or in relation thereto, is provided to the user by the Minister and the Crown without warranty or representation as to any matter including but not limited to whether the information and storage media is correct, accurate or free from error, defect, danger, or hazard, and whether it is otherwise useful or suitable for any use the user may make of it. The Crown in right of Alberta, the Minister and her employees and agents, shall not be liable for any claims, costs, losses, or damages, including any special, indirect, incidental or consequential loss or damage, which the user may incur or experience as a result of the use or possession of the information or associated storage media.

digtinfo.filedec: File compression technology shall be utilized when required. The Data Distribution Unit presently utilizes WinZip.

onlinopt.accinstr: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is available, with the exception of data exceeding reasonable size limits or when corporate restrictions have been implemented in which the data will be delivered on DVD-R or portable hard drive device. The client may be required to provide an FTP TCP / IP address, user name, and password. Data may also be delivered via the Ministry external FTP site utilizing WinZip password encrypted files.

stdorder.ordering: All requests for data / information are accepted via email, FAX, or Canada Post. All requests must include: Government of Alberta Ministry Name / Business Area Name, Physical Address, Contact Person Name(s), Phone and FAX Numbers, email Address, list of products requested, the geographic extent of the request (where product options are available - expressed by NTS block(s), township(s), etc), the delivery option required ( on-line / offline ), the data format when multiple formats are offered, and the intended use of the data.
stdorder.turnarnd: Requests for information are processed and completed in order of receipt with the exception of ESRD requests that are authorized as priority status. All requests for information are completed with five (5) working days of receiving the request wherever possible.

digtinfo.filedec: File compression technology shall be utilized when required. The Data Distribution Unit presently utilizes WinZip.

onlinopt.accinstr: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is available, with the exception of data exceeding reasonable size limits or when corporate restrictions have been implemented in which the data will be delivered on DVD-R or portable hard drive device. The client may be required to provide an FTP TCP / IP address, user name, and password. Data may also be delivered via the Ministry external FTP site utilizing WinZip password encrypted files.

distinfo.custom: Limited custom order processing of Resource Information Management Branch information may be available to Alberta Environment and Sustainable Resource Development personnel and contractors working on behalf of the Ministry.
distinfo.techpreq: To utilize digital information, specialized graphics or GIS software (i.e. ArcInfo, ArcView, ArcGIS, or MicroStation) may be required.
